definitions: Lasting for a very short time: 'The ephemeral beauty of cherry blossoms draws millions each spring.'
Having a transitory existence; short-lived: 'Social media fame is often ephemeral, fading as fast as it arrives.'
(Biology) An organism that lives for only a day or a few days: 'Mayflies are the quintessential ephemeral insect.'
The realization that each passerby has a life as vivid and complex as your own: 'Standing in the subway, a wave of sonder washed over her.'
A profound feeling of connectedness to strangers: 'He experienced sonder while watching the city from the rooftop.'
The awareness of the richness of others' inner worlds: 'Sonder is the antidote to solipsism.'
